DISTRIBUTOR AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is made as of the 1st day of January, 1996 by and between Peregrine/Bridge Transfer Corporation, a Delaware corporation (the "Licensor"), and Neon Systems, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Licensee").

In this revised clause, the focus has been shifted to the distribution agreement having a trial period, and the terminology related to obligations and warranties has been slightly changed to reflect that shift. The obligations of both parties have also been consolidated under one article, with clearer distinctions made between their respective responsibilities. Furthermore, the termination clause now includes early termination rights for either party, enhancing the flexibility of the agreement.

original: 1.4  "Licensed Product" means any copy, or part thereof, of object code of the software products listed on EXHIBIT A attached to this Agreement, as well as any Upgrades or other material distributed to Licensee by Licensor in connection with such software products.

original: ARTICLE 4 ORDER, DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE Section 4.1    ORDER AND DELIVERY.  Licensee shall deliver to Licensor product orders (or other documents of similar purpose and effect) in writing that are signed by an authorized representative of Licensee and that list the quantity, product name, number, version, license fee and proposed delivery date for such order.  Licensor shall ship Licensed Products and Documentation in accordance with Licensee's product orders received and accepted by Licensor.  Licensor shall ship Licensed Products and Documentation F.O.B. Licensor's place of business.  Licensee shall be responsible for all customs fees and other costs and expenses arising in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including costs and expenses related to packing and shipping the Licensed Products and Documentation and any freight and insurance charges, and Licensor may require Licensee to pay for such costs and expenses in advance of shipment of any Licensed Products or Documentation.  Licensor shall not be liable to Licensee for delays in shipments due to causes beyond Licensor's reasonable control.
modified:
ARTICLE 4 ORDER, DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE Section 4.1    ORDER AND RECEIPTION. The Licensor shall be responsible for initiating product orders (or other documents of similar purpose and effect) in writing, signed by an authorized representative, detailing the quantity, product name, number, version, license fee, and proposed delivery date. The Licensee shall receive such orders and is expected to confirm acceptance within a reasonable timeframe.

The Licensor shall ship the Licensed Products and Documentation from Licensor's place of business on an Incoterms 2020 DDP (Delivered Duty Paid) basis. The Licensee shall bear no costs or expenses arising in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, except for any additional charges agreed upon between the parties. The Licensor may absorb these additional charges as a goodwill gesture.

In case of delays in shipments due to causes within the Licensor's reasonable control, the Licensor shall be liable for such delays and may offer appropriate compensation or extend the delivery date at no extra cost to the Licensee.

original: Licensor reserves the right to reject any product order, to cancel any product orders placed by Licensee and accepted by Licensor and to refuse or delay shipment thereof if Licensee fails to make any payments as provided in this Agreement or otherwise continues to fail to comply with the terms and conditions of this Agreement for thirty (30) days after delivery of written notice of such failure.
ollama_generated: Licensor retains the discretionary power to accept or decline any product order placed by the Licensee, and may choose to rescind previously accepted orders as well. Furthermore, Licensor reserves the right to postpone or withhold shipment of ordered products if the Licensee encounters payment issues under this Agreement, or persists in violating the terms and conditions herein for a period of thirty (30) days following receipt of written notice detailing such non-compliance.

original: ARTICLE 7 COVENANTS OF LICENSEE Section 7.1    DUTIES OF LICENSEE.  Licensee shall be solely responsible for the proper advertising, demonstration, shipment, export and collection of payment relating to the Licensed Products and Documentation in the Territory.  The duties of Licensee include without limitation the following:
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 7 COVENANTS OF LICENSEE

Section 7.1    OBLIGATIONS OF LICENSEE.

In the context of the Licensed Products and Documentation within the Territory, Grantee shall bear primary responsibility for advertising, demonstrating, shipping, exporting, and collecting payment. However, Grantee's responsibilities shall not exceed the following:

- Advertising and demonstrating the Licensed Products in a manner that adheres to any applicable laws and regulations, as well as guidelines provided by the Licensor.
- Shipping and exporting the Licensed Products to customers within the Territory, ensuring compliance with customs and shipping requirements.
- Collecting payment from customers for the Licensed Products and Documentation, remitting such payments promptly to the Licensor in accordance with agreed payment terms.

It is understood that any deviations from these responsibilities, or any additional obligations related to the Licensed Products within the Territory, will require the express written consent of the Licensor.

original: (c)  Sending at Licensee's expense qualified and appropriate personnel of Licensee to participate in training sessions, which shall be conducted by Licensor from time to time without charge to Licensee for the benefit of Licensee and Licensee's personnel.
modified: (c) Upon request by Licensor, at the expense of Licensee, providing suitable personnel of Licensee who may attend training sessions, to be held by Licensor at Licensor's discretion. While these sessions are intended for the improvement and education of Licensee's personnel, they do not come without cost to Licensee, as Licensor reserves the right to bill Licensee for any such participation.

original: Section 7.11   NO ENCUMBRANCES.  Licensee shall not engage in the lease, transfer, rental or loan of the Licensed Products or Documentation and Licensee shall not allow the Licensed Products or Documentation to become encumbered by any means.
modified: Section 7.11: FLEXIBLE ENCUMBRANCE PERMISSIONS. While Licensor prefers that the Licensed Products or Documentation are not leased, transferred, rented, loaned, or subject to any form of encumbrance, Licensee's limited exceptions to this preference shall be permissible, provided that such actions do not significantly impair the integrity or value of the Licensed Materials. The Licensor remains responsible for ensuring that the Licensed Products and Documentation are not excessively encumbered under normal business practices.

original: ARTICLE 11 AUDITS Section 11.1   AUDITS.  During the term of this Agreement and the five (5) year period immediately following termination of this Agreement, Licensor will have the right, at its own expense, to audit and examine Licensees records concerning either (a) the reproduction and sublicensing of the Licensed Products and the resulting fees due to Licensor or (b) compliance by Licensee with its obligations as to confidentiality under this Agreement.  During the term of this Agreement and the five (5) year period immediately following termination of this Agreement, Licensee will have the right, at its own expense, to audit and examine Licensor's records concerning compliance by Licensor with its obligations as to confidentiality under this Agreement.  Any such audit shall be conducted during normal business hours, upon at least three business days prior written notification to the party to be audited stating the purpose of the audit and in such a manner so as to not unreasonably interfere with such party's business operations.  The auditing party shall keep any and all information derived from any audits confidential.  Such information is deemed to be "Confidential Information" within the meaning of Article 10.  In relation to such information, the parties to this Agreement are subject to the obligations and remedies set forth in Article 10.  The auditing party shall not use such information for any purpose other than the purpose of the audit as stated in such party's written notification for such audit.  If an audit of Licensee's records and books of account reveals that Licensee has underpaid the fees due under this Agreement to Licensor for the period under audit, Licensee shall pay to Licensor promptly the amount of the underpayment.  If the amount of underpayment for the period under audit exceeds five percent (5%) of the total amount owed during such period, Licensee shall reimburse Licensor for all costs and expenses incurred by Licensor in connection with performing the audit.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 11 AUDITS

Section 11.1   RIGHT TO BE AUDIITED. During the term of this Agreement and the five (5) year period immediately following its termination, Licensor reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to be audited by Licensee at Licensee's expense, for the purpose of verifying:

(a) Compliance by Licensor with its obligations regarding confidentiality under this Agreement. During the audit, Licensor shall provide Licensee with reasonable access to its records and books of account. The audit shall be conducted during normal business hours, upon at least three (3) days prior written notice to Licensor stating the purpose of the audit.

(b) Accuracy of any payments made by Licensee under this Agreement for the reproduction and sublicensing of Licensed Products. If the audit reveals that Licensee has overpaid, Licensor shall refund the excess amount promptly.

In such audits, Licensee shall keep any and all information derived confidential and shall not use such information for any purpose other than the purpose of the audit. Such information shall be deemed to be "Confidential Information" within the meaning of Article 10, and the parties shall be subject to the obligations and remedies set forth in Article 10 regarding such Confidential Information.

If the costs and expenses incurred by Licensee in conducting an audit exceed five percent (5%) of the total amount owed by Licensor during the audited period, Licensor shall reimburse Licensee for all such costs and expenses.

original: If the error or discrepancy is found by Licensee prior to the expiration of the ten (10) day evaluation period set forth in Section 4.2, such evaluation period shall be extended ten (10) days from the date of receipt by Licensee of the corrected Licensed Product from Licensor.
ollama_generated: If a mistake or inconsistency is identified by the Licensee after the initial ten (10) day evaluation period outlined in Section 4.2, but within a subsequent ten (10) days thereafter, such discovery will not interrupt the evaluation period. The Licensor shall have an additional ten (10) days from the date of receipt by the Licensee of the corrected Licensed Product to complete the evaluation period.

original: (1)   Immediately upon written notice if the other party to this Agreement becomes insolvent, is the subject of a petition in bankruptcy that is not resolved within thirty (30) days, admits in writing its inability to pay its debts, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, ceases doing business or attempts an unauthorized assignment of this Agreement; or (2)   Immediately upon written notice if the other party to this Agreement performance of any obligation under this Agreement, including failure to promptly pay any amount due hereunder, and fails to cure such default within thirty (30) days after delivery of written notice specifying the default (with any termination as a result of Licensee's failure to pay amounts due under this Agreement resulting in the acceleration of Licensee's obligation to pay all sums due to Licensor under this Agreement).
ollama_generated:
1. Upon receipt of written notice, the other party to this Agreement shall have thirty (30) days to rectify their situation if they are facing insolvency, bankruptcy petitions that have not been resolved within said period, admit in writing their inability to pay their debts, make an assignment for the benefit of creditors, cease operations or engage in any unauthorized transfer of this Agreement. Failure to remedy the situation within this timeframe shall be deemed as a breach of this Agreement, and we reserve the right to terminate the agreement without further notice.

2. Upon receipt of written notice, the other party to this Agreement has thirty (30) days to resolve any performance issues under this Agreement, including delays in payment of amounts due hereunder. If the default is not cured within this timeframe after delivery of written notice specifying the default, we reserve the right to terminate this Agreement without further notice. It is important to note that such termination will trigger the immediate acceleration of all sums owed by the other party to us under this Agreement.

original: Section 15.7   ASSIGNMENT.  Neither this Agreement nor any of the rights, interests or obligations hereunder shall be assigned by any of the parties hereto without the prior written consent of the other party to this Agreement; provided, however, that Licensor may assign this Agreement to a subsidiary or entity controlling, controlled by or under common control with Licensor.
modified:
Section 15.7 ASSIGNMENT. Any party to this Agreement may assign their rights, interests, or obligations under this Agreement without the need for prior written consent, except that such assignment shall require the approval of the other party if it involves a third-party entity not related by common control, subsidiary, or ownership to the assigning party. Licensor retains the right to freely assign this Agreement to any subsidiary or controlling entity.

In this revised clause, the original obligation for all parties to secure written consent before assignment has been weakened and inverted. Now, each party may assign their rights without prior consent, but the other party's approval is needed if the assignee is not a related entity. Also, Licensor can still assign the agreement to subsidiaries or controlling entities without any conditions.

original: Section 15.10  WAIVER.  Any of the terms, covenants, representations, warranties or conditions of this Agreement may be waived only by a written instrument signed by the party to this Agreement waiving compliance.  No waiver by any party to this Agreement of any condition or breach of any term, covenant, representation or warranty contained in this Agreement, whether by conduct or otherwise, in any one or more instances, shall be construed as a further or continuing waiver of any such condition or breach or a waiver of any other condition or of the breach of any other term, covenant, representation or warranty set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Section 15.10 WAIVER MODIFICATION. Any modification, relaxation, or forbearance of the provisions, obligations, assurances, guarantees, or stipulations within this Agreement can only be made through a written document bearing the signature of the party modifying their compliance. It is expressly clarified that any relaxation by any party to this Agreement of any provision or non-compliance with any term, covenant, assurance, guarantee, or stipulation outlined in this Agreement, whether explicit or implied, shall not be construed as a concession to future non-compliance or a waiver of any other provision or the breach of any other term, covenant, assurance, guarantee, or stipulation encompassed within this Agreement.
